content.full_text:
Petition of D. P. Burns and Others to Orlando B. Ficklin and Abraham Lincoln, [6 December

1847 - 3 March 1849]1
paragraphs: Petition of D. P. Burns and Others to Orlando B. Ficklin and Abraham Lincoln, [6 December

footnotes.text:
1D. P. Burns wrote this petition and signed his name.  The other signatories signed
                  their own names.  The petitioners sent this petition to either Orlando B. Ficklin
                  or Abraham Lincoln sometime during the 30th Congress. Although the petition is located
                  in a collection of petitions presented to the U.S. House of Representatives that were
                  committed to committees, editors could find no evidence of it having been introduced
                  or referred to the Committee on the Post Office and Post Roads, of which Lincoln was
                  a member.

2As the docketing on this page clearly does not match the content of this petition,
                  it is possible that a clerk in the House of Representatives simply wrote the docketing
                  intended for a different document on this petition.

structured_content.text:
Petition of D. P. Burns and Others to Orlando B. Ficklin and Abraham Lincoln, [6 December
               1847 - 3 March 1849]1
